meanings.definition: A soft fabric with a smooth pile, typically made from silk or a synthetic fiber.
meanings.sent1: The royal chair was covered in luxurious velvet.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful velvet dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up on the velvet cushion, looking like a little king.
meanings.sent4: The velvet sky was dotted with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The touch of velvet against her skin was pure comfort.

meanings.definition: A smooth, soft, thick covering resembling velvet, especially on a plant or animal.
meanings.sent1: The petals of the flower had a velvet-like texture.
meanings.sent2: The deer's antlers were covered in a velvety layer.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's ears felt like velvet under the child's fingers.
meanings.sent4: The velvet fur of the rabbit was incredibly soft to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The velvet wings of the butterfly shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Smooth and soft to the touch, resembling velvet in texture.
meanings.sent1: Her velvet voice was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent2: The ripe peach had a velvet skin that felt pleasant against the lips.
meanings.sent3: The velvet grass in the meadow seemed to invite barefoot walks.
meanings.sent4: The velvet touch of the breeze carried the scent of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The velvet petals of the rose held delicate dewdrops in the morning light.
